verses.verse: And the Spirit<WH7307> of God<WH430> came upon Azariah<WH5838> the son<WH1121> of Oded<WH5752>:

And he went out<WH3318> to meet<WH6440> Asa<WH609>, and said<WH559> unto him, Hear<WH8085> ye me, Asa<WH609>, and all Judah<WH3063> and Benjamin<WH1144>; The LORD<WH3068> is with you, while ye be with him; and if ye seek<WH1875> him, he will be found<WH4672> of you; but if ye forsake<WH5800> him, he will forsake<WH5800> you.
Now for a long<WH7227> season<WH3117> Israel<WH3478> hath been without<WH3808> the true<WH571> God<WH430>, and without a teaching<WH3384> priest<WH3548>, and without law<WH8451>.
But when they in their trouble<WH6862> did turn<WH7725> unto the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, and sought<WH1245> him, he was found<WH4672> of them.

And in those times<WH6256> there was no peace<WH7965> to him that went out<WH3318>, nor to him that came in<WH935>, but great<WH7227> vexations<WH4103> were upon all the inhabitants<WH3427> of the countries<WH776>.
And nation<WH1471> was destroyed<WH3807> of nation<WH1471>, and city<WH5892> of city<WH5892>: for God<WH430> did vex<WH2000> them with all adversity<WH6869>.
Be ye strong<WH2388> therefore, and let not your hands<WH3027> be weak<WH7503>: for your work<WH6468> shall be<WH3426> rewarded<WH7939>.

And when Asa<WH609> heard<WH8085> these words<WH1697>, and the prophecy<WH5016> of Oded<WH5752> the prophet<WH5030>, he took courage<WH2388>, and put away<WH5674> the abominable idols<WH8251> out of all the land<WH776> of Judah<WH3063> and Benjamin<WH1144>, and out of the cities<WH5892> which he had taken<WH3920> from mount<WH2022> Ephraim<WH669>, and renewed<WH2318> the altar<WH4196> of the LORD<WH3068>, that was before<WH6440> the porch<WH197> of the LORD<WH3068>.

And he gathered<WH6908> all Judah<WH3063> and Benjamin<WH1144>, and the strangers<WH1481> with them out of Ephraim<WH669> and Manasseh<WH4519>, and out of Simeon<WH8095>: for they fell<WH5307> to him out of Israel<WH3478> in abundance<WH7230>, when they saw<WH7200> that the LORD<WH3068> his God<WH430> was with him.
So they gathered themselves together<WH6908> at Jerusalem<WH3389> in the third<WH7992> month<WH2320>, in the fifteenth<WH2568><WH6240> year<WH8141> of the reign<WH4438> of Asa<WH609>.

And they offered<WH2076> unto the LORD<WH3068> the same time<WH3117>, of the spoil<WH7998> which they had brought<WH935>, seven<WH7651> hundred<WH3967> oxen<WH1241> and seven<WH7651> thousand<WH505> sheep<WH6629>.
And they entered<WH935> into a covenant<WH1285> to seek<WH1875> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of their fathers<WH1> with all their heart<WH3824> and with all their soul<WH5315>;
That whosoever would not seek<WH1875> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> should be put to death<WH4191>, whether<WH4480> small<WH6996> or great<WH1419>, whether man<WH376> or woman<WH802>.
And they sware<WH7650> unto the LORD<WH3068> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, and with shouting<WH8643>, and with trumpets<WH2689>, and with cornets<WH7782>.

And all Judah<WH3063> rejoiced<WH8055> at the oath<WH7621>: for they had sworn<WH7650> with all their heart<WH3824>, and sought<WH1245> him with their whole desire<WH7522>; and he was found<WH4672> of them: and the LORD<WH3068> gave them rest<WH5117> round about<WH5439>.

¶ And also concerning Maachah<WH4601> the mother<WH517> of Asa<WH609> the king<WH4428>, he removed<WH5493> her from being queen<WH1377>, because she had made<WH6213> an idol<WH4656> in a grove<WH842>: and Asa<WH609> cut down<WH3772> her idol<WH4656>, and stamped<WH1854> it, and burnt<WH8313> it at the brook<WH5158> Kidron<WH6939>.
But the high places<WH1116> were not taken away<WH5493> out of Israel<WH3478>: nevertheless the heart<WH3824> of Asa<WH609> was perfect<WH8003> all his days<WH3117>.

¶ And he brought<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of God<WH430> the things that his father<WH1> had dedicated<WH6944>, and that he himself had dedicated<WH6944>, silver<WH3701>, and gold<WH2091>, and vessels<WH3627>.
And there was no more war<WH4421> unto the five<WH2568> and thirtieth<WH7970> year<WH8141> of the reign<WH4438> of Asa<WH609>.
